ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Exception when instantiating Processor (when launching crawl job with a custom processor)
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Hi Jean-Noel, sorry I don t really know it either. I think this has something to do with the internals of the settings framework, but I don t really know.

Jean-Noël Rivasseau schrieb:
> Hi Christian,
> 
> thanks a lot, your suggestion works perfectly. Now, for my own
> curiosity, is it easy to understand why a constructor did not work?
> Internally, how heritrix instantiates the processors?
> 
> Jean-Noel

Hi Jean-Noel,

sorry I don't really know it either.
I think this has something to do with the internals of the settings
framework, but I don't really know. The method initialTasks will be
called only once after the crawl is set up, but before any URIs are
crawled. Using a constructor things seems to be different. The
constructor may be called more than once and the corresponding instances
will be created when Heritrix is set up. So the code in the constructor
may be executed before the crawl itself is set up. That's why variables
you access may be null, I think.

Anyway, can you tell me how to make custom processors show up in the
create drop-down menu in the heritrix webui?
I can't find any properties-files or documentation how this would be done.


Christian

> 
> On Mon, Jun 2, 2008 at 5:08 PM, Christian Krumm
> <signore.chrissi@...> wrote:
>> Hi Jean-Noël Rivasseau,
>>
>> have you tried implementing the interface
>> org.archive.state.Initializable and put your initial code in the
>> initialTasks-method?
>>
>> Christian
>>
>> Jean-Noël Rivasseau schrieb:
>>
>>> *bump*
>>>
>>> Still not understanding why this happens.
>>>
>>> On Thu, May 15, 2008 at 10:24 AM, Jean-Noël Rivasseau <elvanor@...>
>>> wrote:
>>>> Hmm, no I am not debugging in Eclipse or doing anything fancy there...
>>>>
>>>> On Thu, May 15, 2008 at 2:28 AM, Ryan Smith <ryan.justin.smith@...>
>>>> wrote:
>>>>> Not sure if this is going to help you, but i was getting a similar error
>>>>> when trying to debug in eclipse, and i jsut laoded all the binary 2rd
>>>>> party
>>>>> lib jars on the runtime classpath and then i could use the webui fine.
>>>>>
>>>>> I was having this error happen to me when i tried to edit a global Sheet
>>>>> config.
>>>>>
>>>>> On Wed, May 14, 2008 at 10:03 AM, Jean-Noël Rivasseau
>>>>> <elvanor@...>
>>>>> wrote:
>>>>>> Hello, I am very new to Heritrix and am using 2.0.0. When I launch a
>>>>>> job I get the following exception:
>>>>>>
>>>>>> I noticed this happens whenever I have a constructor defined in my
>>>>>> custom Processor class that extends org.archive.modules.Processor.
>>>>>>
>>>>>> This happens even if the constructor code is totally empty. If I
>>>>>> remove the constructor everything works. However having a constructor
>>>>>> to perform initialization would be nice...
>>>>>>
>>>>>> Am I doing something wrong? Any help appreciated.
>>>>>>
>>>>>> Thanks,
>>>>>>
>>>>>> Jean-Noel
